page.title: 12WROXALL ABBEY SCHOOL (1)
page.content: In medieval times the Abbey was a small{Benedictine Convent,}purchased by Robert Burgoyne at the Dissolution. It was bought by{Sir Christopher Wren in 1715,and sold to{James Dugdale}of Liverpool in 1861.The School (formerly the Laurels School Rugby),bought the house and grounds from the Dugdale family in 1936. { Wroxall}is a small school for girls from the age of 9-18,boarding and day, with about 150 pupils. There are 12 full-time teachers and 15 part-time. { The present buildings}were erected by James Dugdale in 1868,and there are beautiful grounds ,with a swimming pool,4 tennis courts, a small gym.,and a lake for the girls to go boating on. Mrs.Iles,the new headmistress,has re- equipped the DS room,and laboratories are being built to mark the{50th {Anniversary}of the school in 1986.
